intro: Hapalochilus aristilabris, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its compact growth habit and attractive blooms. Hapalochilus aristilabris is relatively low maintenance and suitable for rock gardens or as a border plant.
